resources.string: The word "bitcoin" has a few meanings. When referring to "bitcoin," people may mean the network, the protocol, or the open source project.
The word "bitcoin" also means one of the units of value when transacting on the Bitcoin network.
Just like the kilometer can be broken down into meters and centimeters, a bitcoin can be broken into smaller parts.
The most important units to describe bitcoin are the bitcoin and the satoshi. Sometimes we shorten the bitcoin unit to BTC and the satoshi unit to "sats".
There is not yet an "official" symbol for either unit (bitcoin or satoshi). You may see the following symbols on Padawan or in other cryptocurrency exchanges or applications.
We use the bitcoin (BTC) or satoshi (sat) units depending on the size of the transaction.
- A brand new car might be worth 1,700,000,000 sats, but it is more simple to say 1.7 bitcoin.
- You could buy a candy for 0.00000250 bitcoin, but it makes much more sense to say 250 satoshis.

Someone using bitcoin apps must develop the skill to understand both bitcoin and satoshi units. Many transactions are denominated in bitcoin, but their network fee (see tutorial #4) is almost always using the satoshi unit.
In the Padawan app, you can switch between the two units in the main wallet display page by touching the bitcoin/satoshi symbol.
